original_title: Fatal accident kills four in Tambuttegama
original_body_lines: Four people were killed and another four injured following an accident in the Tambuttegama police area this morning, Police said.
They said a van travelling from Kurunegala to Anuradhapura had crashed onto a truck that was about to park on the side of the road while it was driving in the same direction.
The van hit the back of the truck. Eight people in the van were admitted to the Tambuttegama hospital with injuries, and later four of them (two women (36, 43) and two men (26, 46)) died.
Another 55-year-old person, two boys aged 11 and 6, and an eight-year-old girl were among the injured.
Police investigations revealed that the high-speed and reckless driving of the van caused the accident.
The driver of the truck was arrested by the Tambuttegama police in connection with the accident. (DSB)
